Description: A hippopotamus ivory leg: in the form of a bull's foot, standing on a cylindrical, grooved pedestal. The detail of the carving is very good, the veins being depicted and the surface carefully modelled. At the back of the upper surface are the remains of a small tenon, pierced by a single hole for attachment. The top of this tenon is broken but the remainder of the object is in a good state of preservation.
Curator's comments: On the use of such legs, see H. S. Baker, 'Furniture in the Ancient World' (London, 1966), 20-6. For similar objects, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls.XXXII, XXXIV, XXXVII-XLI, XLIII; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Tarkhan I and Memphis V' (London, 1913), pl.XIV, 16-17; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Gizeh and Rifeh' (Warminster, 1977), pl.V, 28; E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ I, (1895-6), pl.XXXII; III, pl.XIV; J. E. Quibell & F. W. Green, 'Hierakonpolis' I (London, 1989), pl.XVI, 6-8; J. E. Quibell, 'Excavations at Saqqara, 1912-1914: Archaic Mastabas’ (Cairo, 1923), pl.XI, 4; J. E. Quibell, ‘Archaic Objects’ (Cairo, 1905), nos. 14045-51. 14703-4. 14751-3; W. C. Hayes, 'The scepter of Egypt : a background for the study of the Egyptian antiquities in the Metropolitan Museum of Art' I (Cambridge, Mass, 1953), 41, fig. 29; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' I' (Cairo, 1949), pl.II; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' II' (London, 1954), pls.XXVII, XXIX; W. B. Emery, 'Excavations at Saqqara, 1937-1938 : Hor-aha' (Cairo, 1939) , 63, fig. 46 and pI.15B; A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’ II (Berlin, 1929-31) nos. 285-9 and pl.35; J. de Morgan, ‘Recherches sur les Origines de l’Égypte II (Paris, 1896-7), 189, figs. 685-8. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 24, pl.VIA, 7 pl.XXXIV, 17.
